sen.j: 1406年（応永13年）後円融天皇の皇后で後小松天皇の生母である通陽門院藤原（三条）厳子の崩後、義満は天皇一代で諒闇（天皇の服喪）が2度あるのは不吉であるという理由から、関白一条経嗣と通じて室である康子を天皇の准母とした。
sen.e: In 1406, Emperor Goenyu's Empress and Emperor Gokomatsu's biological mother Tsuyomon-in FUJIWARA (Sanjyo) no Takako died, and Yoshimitsu decided that it was unlucky to have a ryoan (court mourning) twice during the reign of one emperor, and made his wife Yasuko the foster mother of the Emperor through Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor) Tsunetsugu ICHIJO. In 1407, she was appointed Jusango (honorary rank next to Emperor, Empress Dowager, and Empress, conferred on both men and women), Junior First Rank, and received an ingo, Kitayama-in.

sen.j: 翌1407年（応永14年）に准三后・従一位に叙任され、院号宣下を受けて北山院と称された。
sen.e: In 1407, she was appointed Jusango (honorary rank next to Emperor, Empress Dowager, and Empress, conferred on both men and women), Juichii (Junior First Rank), and received an ingo, Kitayamain.

sen.j: 1408年に義満が没した後、後を継いだ義持は実妹の夫であったが疎遠であったらしく、義持による義満の朝廷政策の否定の影響もあって康子の葬儀は国母に準じた儀ではなかった。
sen.e: After Yoshimitsu died in 1408, she was not in close terms with Yoshimochi, who succeeded him, and together with the effect of his negating the court measures of Yoshimitsu, Yasuko's funeral was not positioned as one for a mother of an Emperor.
